The yield of crops such as pumpkin, ridge gourd, cowpea, and brinjal increased by percentages of 34.9%, 47.2%, 26.9%, and 39.6%, respectively, due to the implementation of rubber dams providing assured water supply in the Chandeswar region.
Wheat production loss due to temperature increase. Note that the text specifies that this is the loss *despite* potential positive effects of increased atmospheric carbon dioxide.
